The course itself is great but could be a bit slower, so the students will have time to understand and rewrite what is shown.
Right now is if I put the speed to the slowest, of course, I get the funny pronunciation and it is not the best that you can follow.

If you are very fast with the keyboard and the mouse you are good to go in that course :)

results.content: I am in Section 3 so far, you are teaching great. However, I have some suggestions, first of all Section 3 says "Introduction" to Modern Php but the content is pretty advanced. Second of all, there are some operators and built-in functions that you use in the videos but you don't explain how they work. For example, you should explain array_filter function or give a reference to that function or you should explain what does "??" do or you should explain what does "&" operator next to a parameter do. I like your way of coding but for not experienced students they are hard to understand while watching your videos.
results.content_html: I am in Section 3 so far, you are teaching great. However, I have some suggestions, first of all Section 3 says "Introduction" to Modern Php but the content is pretty advanced. Second of all, there are some operators and built-in functions that you use in the videos but you don't explain how they work. For example, you should explain array_filter function or give a reference to that function or you should explain what does "??" do or you should explain what does "&" operator next to a parameter do. I like your way of coding but for not experienced students they are hard to understand while watching your videos.

results.content:
It's a great course with simple to understand and detailed explanation!

IMPORTANT NOTE: This course is a bit obsolete (some things were changed in Symfony 5 and actual API Platform library). It means some parts of course will not work and you have to "google" the problem and solve it by yourself. 

As for me it's an advantage which helps to learn deeper. And if you have the same "worldview" - this course for you!
results.content_html:

IMPORTANT NOTE: This course is a bit obsolete (some things were changed in Symfony 5 and actual API Platform library). It means some parts of course will not work and you have to "google" the problem and solve it by yourself.

As for me it's an advantage which helps to learn deeper. And if you have the same "worldview" - this course for you!

results.content: El profesor es extremadamente claro en sus explicaciones. Si bien el ingés no es su lengua materna (como tampoco es la mía), se le entiende perfectamente bien. Es muy claro explicando, y ayuda mucho el hecho de que vaya paso a paso usando "var_dump" para ver el comportamiento del código y familiarizarse con los los mensajes de error de PHP. La única crítica es que mientras sigue explicando lo que acaba de hacer, simultáneamente empieza a crear los archivos para el siguiente paso

results.content:
Describing what you do is not the same as explaining what you do, no matter how thorough the information. This course is very good to get into the details of Symfony API oriented approach but it lacks pedagogy to be even worthwhile for Symfony beginners.
A lot of the content is out of date and requires a lot of troubleshooting to get around ; and there has  been no feedback from the author in about 2 years.
So yeah, all in all, I'm pretty disappointed with this course.

response.content: Thanks for the review, sorry you were dissapointed.
response.content_html: Thanks for the review, sorry you were dissapointed.

results.content:
I have learnt a lot on Symfony 4 framework, API Platform and React Redux just from this course.

I just felt that the unit and functional testing portion could have been more complete by providing more test coverage to the project codebase.

Also, some of the Symfony/API Platform code is slightly outdated and could be updated, I needed to do some adjustments for the app to work properly.

Overall, great course for intermediate/advanced learners!
results.content_html:
I have learnt a lot on Symfony 4 framework, API Platform and React Redux just from this course.

I just felt that the unit and functional testing portion could have been more complete by providing more test coverage to the project codebase.

Also, some of the Symfony/API Platform code is slightly outdated and could be updated, I needed to do some adjustments for the app to work properly.

Overall, great course for intermediate/advanced learners!

results.content:
The course is full of interesting things. It's clear that the teacher knows the subject very well, and you'll learn really a lot about API and React.
Anyway I canntot give him 5 stars, for two reasons:
1 - there are at least 2 places, where the code, as shown in the videos, doesn't work, and you have to correct the bug or add your own code.
One of them is when the API has to return not only the username of the logged user but also the ID. You have to implement a listener in Symfony by yourself.

2 - The other reason is that the project seams not completed, because it lacks of the functionalities for editing and deleting the posts. So, from the react client, you can only create them,,,
results.content_html:
The course is full of interesting things. It's clear that the teacher knows the subject very well, and you'll learn really a lot about API and React.
Anyway I canntot give him 5 stars, for two reasons:
1 - there are at least 2 places, where the code, as shown in the videos, doesn't work, and you have to correct the bug or add your own code.
One of them is when the API has to return not only the username of the logged user but also the ID. You have to implement a listener in Symfony by yourself.

2 - The other reason is that the project seams not completed, because it lacks of the functionalities for editing and deleting the posts. So, from the react client, you can only create them,,,

results.content: Отличный курс, узнал много нового, преподаватель говорит очень чётко и понятно, не возникает проблем с восприятием и повторением информации.

results.content:
Full of useful tips. Would be great if there were 'End of session' commits to a remote repository.
Some few remarks;
- Installing symfony from cli will generally install latest version (5.0.xx), and some classes/methods are deprecated (e.g AdminController for easy_admin)
- Had some difficulty with EventSuscribers but managed a work around with ViewEvent

Thanks for this course
results.content_html:
Full of useful tips. Would be great if there were 'End of session' commits to a remote repository.
Some few remarks;
- Installing symfony from cli will generally install latest version (5.0.xx), and some classes/methods are deprecated (e.g AdminController for easy_admin)
- Had some difficulty with EventSuscribers but managed a work around with ViewEvent

Thanks for this course

results.content:
This was a great course.  The first part around API platform in Symfony was excellent.  The instructor went into great detail and I was able to follow along.

However, the second half dealing with React was not quite a good.  He rushed through parts without really explaining why he was doing what he was doing and there was a lot of jumping around between files that made it confusing.  

Overall however, this is a very through and enjoyable course.  I learned a lot and would recommend to anyone wanting to learn API Platform and React.
results.content_html:
This was a great course. The first part around API platform in Symfony was excellent. The instructor went into great detail and I was able to follow along.

However, the second half dealing with React was not quite a good. He rushed through parts without really explaining why he was doing what he was doing and there was a lot of jumping around between files that made it confusing.

Overall however, this is a very through and enjoyable course. I learned a lot and would recommend to anyone wanting to learn API Platform and React.

results.content: I had some beginner experience on symfony 4 before this. It help me to learn how to implement API in Symfony in best possible way. React part was good enough to cover front end application for this course. Has little bugs, glitches and needs an update to new version of Symfony as well as React. Would recommend to anyone who wants to learn Symfony API fast and in practical way.
results.content_html: I had some beginner experience on symfony 4 before this. It help me to learn how to implement API in Symfony in best possible way. React part was good enough to cover front end application for this course. Has little bugs, glitches and needs an update to new version of Symfony as well as React. Would recommend to anyone who wants to learn Symfony API fast and in practical way.

results.content:
This course seems to me very promising, but Pjotr is talking about one thing while clicking anywhere else, this is too confusing.
I'm missing very much a structure in the course. And sometimes it seems that the code is changing from one lecture to the next. I'm very disappointed.

response.content: The full source code is available on GitHub (links are shown in the course) - with a commit after almost every lesson. You don't have to retype everything you see on the screen during video. I'm explaining concepts here, not what each line is for exactly, so I'm not always talking about what I'm typing at the very moment.
response.content_html: The full source code is available on GitHub (links are shown in the course) - with a commit after almost every lesson. You don't have to retype everything you see on the screen during video. I'm explaining concepts here, not what each line is for exactly, so I'm not always talking about what I'm typing at the very moment.

results.content: Yes, I believe it's a great course. I've been coding on Yii2 for a long time, but there is a moment to improve my skills and switch to Symfony/React to make well-structured applications. Thanks to Piotr for creating all-in-one course for those, who want to try a new approach of creating web-applications (frontend+api).

results.content:
82%+ of the course, but I could not apply the knowledge in real world applications. By memory, I could not even create a simple one. The course is intended, at least, for advanced users that has a good background in Symfony.

Too confusing, superficial, Theoretical and theatrical(it's not live coding+speaking). Didactic is poor. I've got a good Udemy course in React, that is totally different, I know i'm going to truly apply what I've got.  I'm very disappointed with this one here.

results.content:
Great if you want a lecture about how to create an API with php. 
On one hand you can see that the instructor knows about this subject, but on the other hand there are no oportunities as a student to check if you understood the subject.
For example the instructor could give a chance to the students to test their knowledge, like stopping the video and tell them to complete some tasks and after show them how it should be done

results.content:
Ciekawie wyglądała prezentacja ReflectionClass. Kurs spełnił moje wymagania dotyczące wiedzy, jaką chciałem zdobyć. Jest bezkonkurencyjnie lepszy od suchej i chaotycznej dokumentacji.

Co można by poprawić? Czasem są błędy. Te z nich, które nie mają wartości edukacyjnej można by wyciąć w montażu. Później prowadzący znajduje te błędy i je naprawia, ale oglądanie tego kosztuje cenny czas.

Co jest zrobione naprawdę dobrze? Wstęp z PHP przerósł moje najśmielsze wyobrażenia. Kolejność prezentowania treści jest świetnie przemyślana. Wybór zagadnień jest bardzo praktyczny.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Includes everything you need to know about symfony API and React, to start working with it.
Unfortunately the tutor rushes to fast on important parts (for example on the React connection and mapping part) and  could do a bit more explanation on this parts. On other parts with minor priority he spends a lot of time with live coding and talking about why he does this and that, but it is mostly nothing of interest for this lection.
results.content_html:
Includes everything you need to know about symfony API and React, to start working with it.
Unfortunately the tutor rushes to fast on important parts (for example on the React connection and mapping part) and could do a bit more explanation on this parts. On other parts with minor priority he spends a lot of time with live coding and talking about why he does this and that, but it is mostly nothing of interest for this lection.

results.content:
The course is great and the author really experienced.

However I have to say I found really difficult to follow it so far because very often the author is describing something different from what he is typing. 

Very often he is far ahead or far behind what he is talking about, forcing me to stop and go back to properly understand what he is implementing.

Also, I wouldn't recommend this course if you don't have already some experience with Symfony.
results.content_html:

results.content:
All of cource is excelent. Respect to author! 

Subjects to extend this course or use in another:

- too many php annotations in entities at the end. Better to extract them in yaml-files (except filters). 
- no tests in js :( . UnitTest, e2e tests. May be via Symfony Panther?
- not used api platform react/vue generator 
app generation by schema.org annotations.
- it could be perfect to present more PHPStorm hot keys and plugins. IDE is serious accelerator of work process.
- install and use with Docker example. Configure IDE to work with Docker containers.
- no one custom Console command. Cron usage?
- Integration with RabbitMQ? May be via Symfony Messenger? Extract some havy operations from synchronious Request handle process.
- Server push (WebSockets, Mercure)
- Symfony workflow component is awesome and simple. Review and publish blog and comments process as example.
- api platform supports k8s and deploy to Heroku, varnish, https, http/2, https://github.com/dunglas/mercure, etc. Last chapter may consist of review some other posibilities.
results.content_html:

results.content: Although this is a well-documented course and Piotr obviously knows the subject really well, his method has a big flaw. He talks about something while coding the next steps. This is really confusing and off-putting.
results.content_html: Although this is a well-documented course and Piotr obviously knows the subject really well, his method has a big flaw. He talks about something while coding the next steps. This is really confusing and off-putting.

results.content:
I`d like to start from my personal recomendation about this course. Spend more time to find newer course or find some free tutorial. I don`t think that this course worth your money and time.

The course is a little bit outdated. I`m using symfony 4.3.4 and api-platform 2.5 to pass this course. And I alredy had problems which took too many time to solve.

First problem occured in lecture #73. I followed examples during this series but author of comment cobject didn`t return in response. Instead I had iri string. Then, I decided to clone Piotr`s repository to check if I have done mistake. But I can`t install composer dependencies from his repository, so I moved to commit which corresponds to lecture #73 and installed composer dependencies from my composer.lock. But it didn`t help. There was iri string instead of author object. After that I went to api-platform docs and found solution which was, by the way, pretty different.

Next problem occured in lecture #84. Validation failed. And many other studens have the same problem. Piotr pointed out that his approach of validation is not correct and he promised to find better solution. It was 4 months ago and as you can guess there is no new solution yet.

Here the list of disadvantages of this course:
1. Mistakes in examples which are not fixed
2. No references to official docs
3. No review of structure of official docs
results.content_html:

results.content: Really a good course. Learned a lot. New parts are introduced in a simple manner and a simple context and afterwards the code will be refactored in a more generic way. So it is easy to concentrate on the right things. Faults during a session are not cut out of the lessons, they stay in and are solved. With that you are able to learn typical pitfalls and get good explanations to the often cryptic error messages of a framework if you are a beginner.

With that you are able to learn typical pitfalls and get good explanations to the often cryptic error messages of a framework if you are a beginner.

results.content: It's a shame that Udemy doesn't have a lot of video tutorials on Symfony 4. From the material you can see that the lecturer knows Symfony 4, probably is a very good developer, but he does not really understand how to explain/teach the material. First mistake is that there is no code before/after the sections. Second mistake is that he jumps between files without saying what is he doing or what class needs to be included in order to get there. Third mistake is answering questions asked by students - no replies for a month and etc. So this is how it looks like - you constantly have to pause video and rewind back and see what he was doing so you could complete same code in your app. If there is something missed - you have to find out yourself as like I said - no code in between sections. You can't check what maybe you haven't included. And on top of it if you have any questions - simply there is no help here too. As I bought it already - I will do my best to complete the course, but no joy working with this.

response.content: Thanks for feedback. There is the full source code included to the course on GitHub. A commit after each lecture (almost) is there, so you really should be able to find what has changed after each lecture/section.
response.content_html: Thanks for feedback. There is the full source code included to the course on GitHub. A commit after each lecture (almost) is there, so you really should be able to find what has changed after each lecture/section.

results.content_html: It's a shame that Udemy doesn't have a lot of video tutorials on Symfony 4. From the material you can see that the lecturer knows Symfony 4, probably is a very good developer, but he does not really understand how to explain/teach the material. First mistake is that there is no code before/after the sections. Second mistake is that he jumps between files without saying what is he doing or what class needs to be included in order to get there. Third mistake is answering questions asked by students - no replies for a month and etc. So this is how it looks like - you constantly have to pause video and rewind back and see what he was doing so you could complete same code in your app. If there is something missed - you have to find out yourself as like I said - no code in between sections. You can't check what maybe you haven't included. And on top of it if you have any questions - simply there is no help here too. As I bought it already - I will do my best to complete the course, but no joy working with this.

results.content_html: The php7 basics and symfony kernal part is very informative. At some place it needs a little bit of more elaboration.

results.content:
I´m in the 33 chapter. I think that the teacher would be more specific with the dependencies charges and use a free scripting software like Visual Studio for the course, because the "PHP Storm", has a lot of automated actions that other don´t  and sometimes, for example, some rows of "use" statements, don´t are loaded on the class document and it causes some headaches .
I think too that the teacher could just skip some errors that occurs on some lessons. 

Anyway, I recommend this course to be ready quickly with symfony and the introduction of modern php is pretty good , I feel that it will be very useful for my work.

response.content: Hi and thanks for feedback. I'd agree that using PHPStorm is not the best choice for beginners and that the course needs to be updated to be more clear when things are generated "magically" by IDE. Just as a side note, this course comes with a GitHub repository with a commit almost after every lecture when code can be checkout out without worrying that you did not re-type something fast enough from the screen. Thanks, those are valid points.
response.content_html: Hi and thanks for feedback. I'd agree that using PHPStorm is not the best choice for beginners and that the course needs to be updated to be more clear when things are generated "magically" by IDE. Just as a side note, this course comes with a GitHub repository with a commit almost after every lecture when code can be checkout out without worrying that you did not re-type something fast enough from the screen. Thanks, those are valid points.

results.content_html:
I´m in the 33 chapter. I think that the teacher would be more specific with the dependencies charges and use a free scripting software like Visual Studio for the course, because the "PHP Storm", has a lot of automated actions that other don´t and sometimes, for example, some rows of "use" statements, don´t are loaded on the class document and it causes some headaches .
I think too that the teacher could just skip some errors that occurs on some lessons.

Anyway, I recommend this course to be ready quickly with symfony and the introduction of modern php is pretty good , I feel that it will be very useful for my work.
